title: (Pwn2Own) Phoenix Contact CHARX SEC-3100 MTQQ Protocol JSON Parsing Type Confusion Information Disclosure Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Phoenix Contact CHARX SEC-3100 devices. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of JSON-encoded arrays. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a type confusion condition. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the service account.
addtionnal_details: Phoenix Contact has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://cert.vde.com/en/advisories/VDE-2024-011/
timeline:
2024-02-02 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2024-06-21 - Coordinated public release of advisory
